image.altText: Man in a blue NLC polo shirt and green cap.

props.synopsis: Four foreign nationals who arrived on remote NT coastline have had an extraordinary conversation with some of their rescuers.

title.children: NT boat arrivals paid $9k each to travel to Australia, rangers told via Google Translate app

image.altText: A Qantas plane at a runaway with baggage handlers and workers in high-viz, blue sky. Longreach Airport sign.

props.synopsis: As major airlines face a Senate inquiry and airfare rise across Australia, outback residents are paying the price of an international ticket to travel to their nearest capital city.

title.children: Outback residents face $1,250 return flights to nearest capital as competition dwindles

image.altText: Woman wearing pink shirt and jeans seats in a blue helicopter.

props.synopsis: Olivia Anderson, 24, is the recipient of this year's prestigious Roger Connellan Award, which is granted to outback Australia's best young pilots.

title.children: Olivia Anderson took a risk to become a helicopter mustering pilot, but now it is paying off

image.altText: A young Aboriginal man leans forward on the white rodeo arena railing and stares at the camera. He wears green prison garb.

props.synopsis: Police have arrested a senior employee with Australia's largest Indigenous legal aid service after she was allegedly caught harbouring a convicted killer in an Alice Springs hotel room.

title.children: Convicted killer fugitive allegedly caught in Alice Springs hotel room with senior NAAJA employee

image.altText: Red cows in an outback paddock.

props.synopsis: Police allege investigators found about 70 cattle had no access to drinking water for 10 days in March 2023 at the Old Man Plains research facility near Alice Springs.

title.children: Woman charged as NT police allege research station cattle died of dehydration, not cyanide poisoning

image.altText: A Rex aircraft seen through a window at an airport terminal, in the foreground inside are airport seats.

props.synopsis: The federal government announces a bailout for Rex Airlines, while an ACCC report has revealed domestic airfares have risen since Rex's collapse.

title.children: Coldplay or price gouging? Regulators investigate why Australians are paying more for domestic flights

image.altText: Houses under construction on a bright, sunny day

props.synopsis: State governments will be rewarded if they clear away red tape to unlock more modular homes, under a new federal government fund to be announced by Treasurer Jim Chalmers today.

title.children: Australia builds homes less efficiently now than 30 years ago. A new federal fund will pay states to pursue a change

image.altText: A digital board with multiple rows reading "cancelled".

props.synopsis: Jetstar, Qantas and Virgin Australia have cancelled flights to and from Bali until at least Wednesday afternoon.

title.children: Flights to and from Bali cancelled after volcanic eruption creates thick ash cloud

image.altText: An Aboriginal woman stands in front of the federal court in Perth wearing a white shirt and jeans

props.synopsis: Wunna Nyiyaparli elder Ailsa Coffin says her family's connection to Roy Hill stretches back generations, and a United Nations decision has backed her up. The federal government disagrees.

title.children: WA clan vows to continue fighting for native title rights despite Australian government's rejection of UN finding

image.altText: Elon Musk speaks from behind a lecturn next to Donald Trump at a rally, with both men behind bullet-proof glass.

props.synopsis: US President-elect Donald Trump reveals Elon Musk's role and is expected to continue his hardline appointments and name Florida senator Marco Rubio — whom he has previously called "lightweight" and "Mr Meltdown" — as secretary of state.

title.children: Trump gives Elon Musk role to 'dismantle bureaucracy' and slash regulations from outside government

image.altText: A close up shot of Donald Trump looking at Xi Jinping.

props.synopsis: With the apparent appointment of two of America's most hawkish Republicans, president-elect Donald Trump looks to be setting the stage for a confrontational relationship with China.

title.children: Why two rumoured appointments to Trump's inner circle sends one big message to China

image.altText: A hiker on top of a mountain

props.synopsis: Global emissions look to rise in 2024, a new Carbon Budget report reveals. Climate scientists say it's "grim news" because the world has the technology to change that. What's missing, they say, is political will.

title.children: The world has the technology to stop emissions from rising. Climate scientists are frustrated and explain what's holding us back

image.altText: Convicted sex offender Peter John van de Wetering smiling in front of a grey wall

props.synopsis: Peter van de Wetering was sentenced to nine years in 2016 for the violent attack on the 19-year-old woman.

title.children: Backpacker rapist who lured woman to remote Queensland farm wins appeal for release

image.altText: A blue sign saying Queanbeyan District Health Service sits at the entrance to the carpark of a hospital

props.synopsis: An email obtained by the ABC confirms Queanbeyan Hospital has stopped providing surgical terminations for fetal anomalies and medical reasons, restricting access to a legal and time-critical form of reproductive health care.

title.children: Queanbeyan Hospital bans surgical abortions, telling local health workers the procedure 'does not currently sit within' its scope

image.altText: A man in religious attire stands looking solemnly away from the camera

props.synopsis: The Archbishop had faced calls to resign after a report last week found he had taken insufficient action to stop a person it described as arguably the Church of England's most prolific serial abuser.

title.children: Spiritual leader of Anglicans worldwide Justin Welby resigns after sexual abuse scandal

image.altText: A church building with a cross shrouded under branches

props.synopsis: The Catholic Church wins a High Court appeal against rulings it was vicariously liable for the actions of a priest who allegedly sexually abused a five-year-old in 1971.

title.children: Catholic Church wins High Court appeal against ruling it was vicariously liable for alleged sexual abuse by a priest

image.altText: A phone displaying the meta logo sits on a computer keyboard

props.synopsis: This year's Shonky Awards have been announced, with Facebook parent company Meta amongst the winners for its "inadequate action" against scams.

title.children: The five 'shonkiest' products and companies put in the spotlight in annual CHOICE consumer awards

image.altText: Ezra Mam catches a ball during warm up before a Broncos game

props.synopsis: Brisbane Broncos NRL star Ezra Mam is hit with two charges over a head-on car crash last month.

title.children: Broncos star Ezra Mam charged over head-on collision, allegedly failing second drug test

image.altText: Composite image of six victims of jumping castle tragedy with school signage as background

props.synopsis: An engineer says having all available anchor points secured on a jumping castle may not have prevented it becoming airborne — but still, not enough was done to ensure safety before six children died in 2021.

title.children: Engineer says Hillcrest jumping castle may still have become airborne even if all anchors were used

image.altText: A person looking at images of women in bikinis on a computer

props.synopsis: A report by Our Watch has revealed the average teenage Australian girl has viewed pornography before her 14th birthday, with fears it is becoming a default source of sexual education for children.

title.children: Young people encountering porn earlier than ever and using it for sex education, new report finds

image.altText: A large truck carrying pallets of aid bundles through a dusty border crossing.

props.synopsis: The US will continue to provide military assistance to the Netanyahu government, despite aid agencies saying it has fallen short of providing enough aid to the wartorn region.

title.children: Aid agencies accuse Israel of failing to provide enough support to Gaza as US deadline passes

image.altText: Lightning strikes nearby a house in suburban australia during a storm

props.synopsis: Thunderstorms and torrential rain have hit across Australia this week, with forecasts suggesting this weather could continue through this week and to the end of the year.

title.children: Torrential rain hits Australia's east coast, with climate drivers activating thunderstorm season

image.altText: High Court of Australia

props.synopsis: Two survivors of alleged child sex abuse win their High Court battle to sue those who placed them in care in the 50s and 60s.

title.children: Two survivors of alleged historic child sex abuse win High Court battle to sue for compensation

image.altText: Semi rural land with some cattle and green paddocks, small industrial

props.synopsis: Residents make a final plea to the Independent Planning Commission to reject a proposed $88-million plastic recycling plant in Moss Vale due to concerns over its environmental, health, and community impact.

title.children: Julia Zemiro among residents fighting plan to build recycling plant in 'renaissance' town

image.altText: A digital tablet is attached to a shopping trolley.

props.synopsis: Woolworths says it wants to roll out its smart shopping trolleys to more stores to help people budget their shops better. Smart carts overseas have helped increase the average customer spend by 6 per cent.

title.children: The tech company behind Woolworths 'smart' shopping trolleys says they could help you buy more impulsively

image.altText: The exterior of a Commonwealth Bank branchm including the brand's logos.

props.synopsis: Wages growth has slowed to 3.5 per cent over the past year, but continues to outpace inflation. Meanwhile, a fall on Wall Street has sent Australian stocks sharply lower. Follow the latest updates in our live blog.

title.children: Wages growth slows, CBA logs flat first-quarter profit, ASX falls

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Outlook good for new houses, but not so great for apartments
Tabcorp pays penalty for taking illegal online in-play sports bets
All eyes on tomorrow's ABS jobs figures

image.altText: Samantha Harvey, a blonde woman in her 40s, holds up a book with artistic pictures of space on the cover.

props.synopsis: It takes 90 minutes for the International Space Station to orbit the Earth. That journey happens 16 times in Orbital, which just won one of the world's top literary awards.

title.children: 'There's nothing to do and there's everything to do': Novel set in space wins $98,000 Booker Prize

image.altText: Houses under construction on a bright, sunny day

props.synopsis: State governments will be rewarded if they clear away red tape to unlock more modular homes, under a new federal government fund to be announced by Treasurer Jim Chalmers today.

title.children: Australia builds homes less efficiently now than 30 years ago. A new federal fund will pay states to pursue a change

image.altText: A boy facing away from the camera in a hospital bed holds hand with a man with a beard.

props.synopsis: Muswellbrook has been rocked by more than 50 quakes since August that have damaged buildings, but some home owners have had their insurance claims rejected on the basis the issues were "pre-existing".

title.children: Homeowners hit by earthquake swarm question value of insurance after claims denied

image.altText: Three men vote at a polling station in Hobart, Tasmania.

props.synopsis: A suspicious number of multiple returns — defined as more than one postal ballot pack returned from a single voter — were flagged in Whittlesea City Council Lalor Ward and Knox City Council Baird Ward elections.

title.children: Legitimacy of two Victorian council elections in question after duplicate votes detected

image.altText: A Korean woman with short hair sitting at desk wearing Kodak yellow fleece.

props.synopsis: The radical feminist 4B movement took root in a culture where women face domestic violence and insidious spy-cam sexploitation, as well as the "double burden" of work and family.

title.children: Women in the US are joining a 'sex strike', but in Korea, 4B is a radical way of living

image.altText: A man on a bike rides through the street with ruins of buildings behind him

props.synopsis: Some 50,000 Russian troops have reportedly moved to a region held by Ukraine since August, with experts saying it is no coincidence that the renewed interest coincides with the US presidential race and the re-election of Donald Trump.

title.children: Russia wants Ukraine's 'bargaining chip' before Donald Trump returns to the White House

image.altText: A centrelink sign with on a building with a reflection

props.synopsis: Advocacy groups have called for further reform of the Disability Support Pension and condemned the federal government for its response to a Senate inquiry into the payment.

title.children: Is the Disability Support Pension fit for purpose? Advocates say it needs a transformation

image.altText: A robot that resembles a CCTV camera is attached to the front of a research vessel.

props.synopsis: Employees could be monitored at work or subjected to discrimination during recruitment if there is not appropriate oversight of artificial intelligence in the workplace, according to unions. But Australia's peak business body has cautioned against introducing further regulation that could prevent local businesses from having a "competitive edge".

title.children: Artificial intelligence could lead to workplace surveillance without further oversight, unions say

image.altText: A woman holds a red sign which reads 'i can get 18% more in qld'

props.synopsis: The industrial action has been condemned by the state government who warned of a "challenging day" ahead for people accessing healthcare in the public system, that is not life-preserving or emergency.

title.children: Hundreds of elective surgeries cancelled as 10,000 nurses and midwives walk off job in NSW
